name: htmlCodeFormat
description:
Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents and inserts <pre> and </pre> tags at the beginning and end of the string.
The only difference between this function and `HTMLEditFormat` is that `HTMLEditFormat` doesn't surround the text in HTML `pre` tags.

params.name: string
params.description: A String or variable that contains one.

params.name: version
params.description:
HTML version to use. Currently ignored.
 -1: The latest implementation of HTML
 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default)
 3.2: HTML 3.2

examples.title: Tag Syntax
examples.code: <cfset testString="This is a test & this is another <This text is in angle brackets> Previous line was blank!!!">   <cfoutput>#htmlCodeFormat(testString)#</cfoutput>
